intro: Myoxanthus spilanthus, commonly known as the yellow-leaf myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, pale flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
